discussion.content: CRM Analytics access the data in the context of the Analytics Integration User. ( Answer A )

i think A as well based on this link https://www.salesforceblogger.com/2019/08/26/but-thats-not-my-preferred-currency/
The integration user is the user that is used to bring data from Salesforce to Einstein Analytics. If the integration user does not have access to an object or a field you will get an error in your dataflow trying to pull it in. But there is another important thing to know of this user. The locale and currency settings for this user is what Einstein Analytics uses. Hence if your integration user has “British Pounds” as the currency your currency in Einstein Analytics will be British Pounds too

Selected Answer: A
I believe it is A

choices.C: In the currency that is set on the "currency" attribute in the dataset
choices.B: In the currency that is set on the "currency" attribute in the dataflow

questions.question_text:
A company's Salesforce org has multi-currency enabled. This company's business intelligence team used Tableau CRM to build a dataflow that creates a dataset,
"OpportunityDataSet". This dataset is populated with data extracted from the standard object, Opportunity. One of the extracted fields is the standard field,
Amount.
If a user explores the "OpportunityDataSet" in Tableau CRM, in which currency will the Amount values be shown?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B and C are correct here

Selected Answer: BC
Option B and C are correct.
https://youtu.be/N1Z7GYS16Ug?t=439

choices.D: Manually remove the sales below 0 (negative sales must be a data issue), but keep the large values (the more data, the better the model will be).
choices.A: Remove the outliers as suggested by Einstein and deploy the model.
choices.B: Remove the outliers as suggested by Einstein, and verify using model metrics and story insights if the quality improved.
choices.C: Discuss with the client if values below 0 and above 2,489 are so uncommon that they should perhaps be left out of the story.

questions.question_text:
The Tableau CRM team at a company created a dataset based on the Sales_Target c custom object. The VP of Sales reports seeing the message "No results
ן¼¿
found" when opening the dataset to explore it. Other users below the VP in the role hierarchy can see rows on the same dataset.
Which problem might be causing this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
ecurity Predicates are used to apply row-level security to datasets in Tableau CRM. They can restrict data visibility based on user attributes. It is possible that the security predicates are incorrectly configured in such a way that they prevent users higher in the hierarchy from viewing the data, even though this is counterintuitive to usual security settings.

Selected Answer: A
I believe A is the correct answer. The other options( B, C and D) would need to use "Inheriting Sharing Rules" instead of Security Predicate. "Inheriting Sharing Rules" does NOT support custom objects.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_security_datasets_sharing_limits.htm&type=5

choices.B: The dataset is inheriting sharing from Salesforce and the VP can see more than 3000 rows. D. The Salesforce profile for the VP does not have read permission on the Sales_Target c custom object. ן¼¿
choices.A: The Security Predicates set up at the dataset level are preventing the VP from seeing data. B. The Salesforce profile for the VP does not have read permission on some fields of the Sales_Target c custom object. ן¼¿

questions.question_text:
The client asks a Tableau CRM Consultant to build a dashboard with a chart that shows revenue and quantity of units sold.
Which type of Combo Chart can the consultant use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Line over Bar Combo Chart is a common type used in Tableau CRM. It allows you to display two measures on two different axes, which can be useful for showing the relationship between revenue (as a bar) and quantity of units sold (as a line)

choices.D: The customer's org must have a Shield Platform Encryption tenant secret.
choices.B: By default, the same keys are used to encrypt data in Tableau CRM as are used to encrypt data in Salesforce objects.
choices.C: When Tableau CRM Encryption is enabled, all newly registered datasets are encrypted at rest.
choices.A: Bring Your Own Key is not supported.

questions.question_text:
A Tableau CRM Consultant is implementing encryption for a customer.
Which two statements about Tableau CRM Encryption are true? (Choose two.)
